item.title: Tracey add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet." -- Plato

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something." -- Plato

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!" -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Johann wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Divide and rule, a sound motto. Unite and lead, a better one." -- Johann wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "True life is lived when tiny changes occur." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Tracey add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tracey add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description:
"I am a Jew. Hath not a Jew eyes? Hath not a Jew hands, organs, dimensions, senses, affections, passions; fed with the same food, hurt with the same weapons, subject to the same diseases, heal'd by the same means, warm'd and cool'd by the same winter and summer, as a Christian is?
If you prick us, do we not bleed? If you tickle us, do we not laugh? If you poison us, do we not die?
And if you wrong us, do we not revenge? If we are like you in the rest, we will resemble you in that." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tracey add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Julius Caesar
item.description: "Veni, vidi, vici. (<i>I came, I saw, I conquered</i>.)" -- Julius Caesar

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Hillary Rodham Clinton
item.description: "Every child needs a champion." -- Hillary Rodham Clinton

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Hillary Rodham Clinton
item.description: "In the bible it says you have to forgive seventy times seven. I want you all to know, I'm keeping a chart." -- Hillary Rodham Clinton

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Hillary Rodham Clinton
item.description: "If I want to knock a story off the front page, I just change my hairstyle." -- Hillary Rodham Clinton

item.title: Tracey add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to be alone than in bad company." -- George Washington

item.title: Tracey add a quote by alice walker
item.description: "I think it pisses God off if you walk by the color purple in a field somewhere and don't notice it." -- alice walker

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Like I said...fine with me." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Herb Caen
item.description: "One day if I do go to heaven...I'll look around and say, 'It ain't bad, but it ain't San Francisco." -- Herb Caen

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Charles McCabe
item.description: "I think it may truly said that if you are tired of San Francisco, you are tired of life." -- Charles McCabe

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Herb Caen
item.description: "Isn't it nice that people who prefer Los Angeles to San Francisco live there?" -- Herb Caen

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "If a book about failures doesn't sell, is it a success?" -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Tracey add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Hope is a waking dream." -- Aristotle
